sen.j: 義空（ぎくう、生没年不詳）は、平安時代前期唐から渡来した禅僧。
sen.e: Giku (date of birth and death unknown) was a Zen-sect priest from Tang China in the former Heian period.

sen.j: 中国杭州海昌院斉安国師に師事。
sen.e: He learned under 海昌院斉安国師 in Hang Zhou, China.

sen.j: 835年（承和2年）皇太后橘嘉智子が恵萼（えがく）を使者として唐に送って唐の禅僧を招聘した際、斉安の推挙により来日した。
sen.e: When Empress Dowager TACHIBANA no Kachiko invited a Zen sect priest from Tang China by sending Egaku as the messenger in 835, Giku came to Japan due to 斉安's recommendation.

sen.j: 初め東寺西院に住したが、その後嘉智子が創建した檀林寺に移ってその開基となった。
sen.e: At first Giku lived in To-ji Sai-in(the western part of To-ji Temple) and then moved to Danrin-ji Temple, which was established by Kachiko, becoming the founder of the temple.

sen.j: 仏道を問う者は多かったというが、禅宗自体は不振で数年で唐に戻った。
sen.e: It is said that a lot of people visited him for Buddhism but Zen sect itself didn't become popular and Giku returned to Tang after a few years.

sen.e: It is said that when Egaku revisited Tang China, he engraved Giku's accomplishments in a monument, sent it to Japan and built it beside Rajomon Gate in Kyoto.
